subject: Re: How to use JUnit for multi-threaded code?
msgSnippet: ... API ... toolsmith ... applications. ... I ve used Andy Schneider s Multithreaded Test Case with success:
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Pat Farrell <pfarrell@...> wrote:
>
> Java has been multi-threaded from the start, and Java 5 has native
API
> support for things like Barriers that used to be rolled by a
toolsmith
> reading the O'Reilly "Java Threads" book.
>
> It is not clear to me how to use JUnit to test multi-thread
applications.
>
> Is it possible?
> Any hints and tips?
>
I've used Andy Schneider's Multithreaded Test Case with success:
http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-12-2000/jw-1221-junit_p.html

Also see this article, which has a few examples illustrating the
problems running multithreaded tests in JUnit:
http://today.java.net/pub/a/today/2003/08/06/multithreadedTests.html
